gurmukhi: ਭੰਨੇ ਦੈਤ ਪੁਕਾਰੇ; ਰਾਜੇ ਸੰੁਭ ਥੈ ||
transliteration: Bhanne Dait Poukdare Raaje Sounbh Thai||
translation: The demons ran to their king Sumbh and beseeched;
“Lochan Dhum has been killed alongwith his soldiers;

gurmukhi: ਚੁਣਿ ਚੁਣਿ ਜੋਧੇ ਮਾਰੇ; ਅੰਦਰ ਖੇਤ ਦੈ ||
transliteration: Choun(i) Choun(i) Jodhe Mdare Andar Khet Dai||
translation: “She hath seleted the warriors and killed them in the battlefield;
“It seems that the warriors have fallen like the stars from the sky;

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਪੱਰਬਤ ਭਾਰੇ; ਮਾਰੇ ਬਿੱਜੁ ਦੇ ||
transliteration: Gire Parbat Bhdare Mdare Bijj(u) Soorme||
translation: “The huge mountains have fallen, having been smote by the lightning;

gurmukhi: ਦੈਤਾਂ ਦੇ ਦਲ ਹਾਰੇ; ਦਹਸਤ ਖਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Daitaan De Dal Hdare Dahsat Khaae Kai||
translation: “The forces of the demons have been defeated on becoming panicky;

gurmukhi: ਬਚੇ ਸੁ ਮਾਰੇ ਮਾਰੇ; ਰਹਦੇ ਰਾੲਿ ਥੈ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Bache Su Mdare Mdare Rahade Raae Thai||29||
translation: “Those who were left have also been killed and the remaining have come to the king.”29.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਹ ਹੋੲਿ ਬੁਲਾੲੇ; ਰਾਕਸਿ ਰਾੲਿ ਨੇ ||
transliteration: Roh Hoe Bulaae Rakas(i) Raae Ne||
translation: Highly enraged, the king called the demons.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਡ ਅਰ ਮੁੰਡ ਪਠਾੲੇ; ਬਹੁਤਾ ਕਟਕੁ ਦੈ ||
transliteration: Channd Ar Mounnd Pathaae Bahoutaa Katak(u) Dai||
translation: Chand and Mund were sent with huge forces.
It seemed that the swords coming together were like the thatched roofs.

gurmukhi: ਜੇਤੇ ਰਾੲਿ ਬੁਲਾੲੇ; ਚੱਲੇ ਜੁੱਧ ਨੋ ||
transliteration: Jete Jaae Bulaae Challe Juddh No||
translation: All those who were called, marched for war.

gurmukhi: ਜਣ ਜਮ ਪੁਰ ਪਕੜ ਚਲਾੲੇ; ਸਭੇ ਮਾਰਨੇ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Jan Jam Pur Pakad Chadhaae Sabhe Maaranaa||30||
translation: It appear that they were all caught and sent to the city of Yama for killing.30.
